events.name: Google Next Billion Users (NBU): Product Design Lessons from UX
events.description: Please register here, http://sginnovate.com/events/google-next-billion-users-nbu-product-design-lessons-ux Google Next Billion Users (NBU): Product Design Lessons from UX Presented by SGInnovate. Partnered with Google. User Experience Design is often thought about as the last mile in the product development process. In the past few years, Google has launched several products that are relevant to users who are coming online for the very first time. While building these products, Google learnt that User Experience (UX) is not just a designer's job. With successful collaboration with business development, marketing, engineering and product management teams we have integrated designing thing deep into our product development cycle. This session will focus on what it means for products team to be design-driven with some examples and success stories. Date: 23 May 2018Time: 5:30pm – 7:30pmVenue: 32 Carpenter Street, Singapore 059911 Programme:5:30pm – 6:00pm: Registration6:00pm – 7:00pm: Product Design Lessons from UX7:00pm – 7:30pm: Q&A and End Speaker: Kishore Kumar, Product Designer, Tez Kishore is a Product Designer on Tez. He joined Google as their first designer on the Next Billion Users initiative. There he builds products for users in high-growth markets like India. His previous experience includes Adobe, Designit and IDEO where he handled a range of projects including digital design, exhibition design and service design. He’s passionate about motorcycles. About the Google Next Billion Users (NBU): The internet's future lies with its next billion users. They are coming online through smartphones and using the Internet in radically new ways. There is a massive potential and innovation to help solve their challenges with technology. The Next Billion User initiative at Google is strongly committed to building products and experiences for these users first, and this series of talks aim to share some of what we've learnt so far along the way.

Learn to think by learning to code.

Shaping Future Creators
First Code Academy is a leading education institute that teaches kids coding courses and develop curriculum for K-12 students to learn not just coding skills, but computational thinking. Our goal is to empower children and teenagers to become creative leaders in the digital era, for their future career and for driving social change.

events.name: Elm Coding
events.description: We were lucky to have our May Meetup accepted at WeWork's offices. So you can already now plan your schedule for another round of coding and Elm networking. What to expect:- A relaxed and friendly atmosphere.- A round of presentation to introduce our selves and share some Elm projects to spark interests for pairings.- The main part will be hands-on where we will team up in smaller groups and work on some Elm of your own choosing. No previous experience is required, there is room for both beginners and people with Elm experience.- If someone has something they would like to show and maybe get feedback on we can end the evening with a sharing session.- Afterwards we go out for a drink at a nearby place. What to bring:- Your Laptop and a desire to code some Elm- You Id card for entering the building- Something to eat, or grab something to eat beforehand. NOTE: Please make sure that we have your full name as we need for the automated registration at WeWork. You can answer the RSVP question to this invite.
events.location: WeWork Beach Centre, Singapore, WeWork Beach Centre, 15 Beach Road

events.name: Coding with Java:  Test-driven Development (TDD)
events.description: • What we'll doJoin us for an exciting workshop on Test-Driven Development using Java. Test-driven development (TDD) is a style of development where coding, testing, and design are tightly interwoven. As opposed to the traditional way of development, TDD requires you to write a test before you write the actual code. In this workshop, we will discuss the essence of what makes TDD work and show how understanding the principles means that we can use tests to help us deliver more effectively. This workshop is facilitated by our network member Fay Adams. Content:- What is TDD?- Essence of TDD- Code Kata: Red-Green-Refactor!- TDD and object oriented design- Guiding design with tests Schedule:6.30 - 7.00 PM: Check-in & Networking7.00 - 7.15 PM: Updates from Women Who Code & Host Introduction7.15 - 7.45 PM: Hands on workshop7.45 – 7.55 PM: Break7.55 – 8.20 PM: Hands on workshop8.20 - 8.30 PM: Final remarks & networking This event is intended for everyone who aims to support & inspire women in technology. • What to bringPlease bring your laptops with some pre-requisites installed:- Java 8 (the default language of choice for this training)- Git- IntelliJ IDEA or Eclipse- Your preferred testing framework • Important to knowPlease bring your photo id for registration at the venue reception. All attendees kindly read and abide by the Women Who Code Code of Conduct - https://github.com/WomenWhoCode/guidelines-resources/blob/master/code_of_conduct.md
events.location: Rakuten, 138 Market Street, Lvl 32, CapitaGreen, 048946, Singapore

events.name: ProductTank #17: Celebrating World Product Day!
events.description: We're excited to announce that ProductTank Singapore is celebrating World Product Day on 23rd of May!http://worldproductday.com/ [FIRST TALK]Ville Nordström from Coda Payments "Early product decisions, or knowing when to try a wrong turn - Case Codashop" Ville is a seasoned product grunt, currently with Coda Payments in Singapore, making it easier for people in SEA to conveniently spend their money online. May be partially accountable for past product woes at Zalora and Accenture Finland. [SECOND TALK]Ridzwan Aminuddin from Ninjavan "Slaying the API beast - for Product Managers" As product guys we often have to work with APIs, yet many of us aren't even familiar with the concept of an API much less how to work with engineers who speak API. This session is meant to provide you with a high level overview of APIs and equip you with the fundamentals suitable for product managers and empower you to decipher and analyse common api document formats. Ridzwan Aminuddin is an entrepreneurial and passionate product leader with deep experience in mobile, web, digital data and e-commerce. He has over 10 years experience leading product and technology teams to carry out large-scale, complex consumer/commercial enterprise products and services. Ridzwan is currently the head product guy at Ninja Van, and is focussed on building a kickass product team with world-class product practices to disrupt last-mile logistics in South East Asia. His favourite quote in product management is “A great product manager has the brain of an engineer, the heart of a designer, and the speech of a diplomat. AGENDA 18:30 - Registration starts. 19:00 - Registration ends. 19:00 - Quick intro about ProductTank Singapore & a few words from the location host. 19:05 - First talk + Q&A 19:30 - Break & time for networking 19:45 - Second talk + Q&A 20:15 - More networking 21:00 - Event ends
events.location: Zalora Singapore Office, Keppel Towers , 10 Hoe Chiang Road, #18-01, 089315

events.name: Compliance as Code with Inspec
events.description: Have you ever feared the word "Compliance" and having an auditor at your doorstep? What happens when you get a huge report of things to fix in order to stay compliant with IT rules and regulations? Well this isn't a story about "an apple a day keeps the auditor away", but an actual hands on that allows you to apply the lessons you have learned from Infrastructure as Code to Compliance as Code, as Inspec provides a way to implement your own rules, modify and version them and even reuse complex resources already published to stay ahead of the game. In this day and age, we don't want to be just compliant, but also as secure as possible, establish behaviours for our infrastructure and see how to build better systems. For this session, we will be holding a hands-on session for participants to walk through a few exercises and try out the tech. Put on your developer hat, bring your laptop, and let's get to work! Agenda1830 - Start Registration, mingle over some food1900 - General Introduction1915 - Let's get to Work2030 - Wrap up • What to bring- Bring your laptop, we're going to do some hands-on work here! The only thing you need is to be able to connect to wifi. • Important to know- Some basic knowledge of ruby although you will be fine even seeing this at first glance. We'll also have people around to help if you get stuck. • Preparation WorkBefore attending the session, you should have the following set up.- Either Install ChefDK (https://downloads.chef.io/chefdk) that contains the full software suite or directly InSpec (https://downloads.chef.io/inspec)- Install Virtualbox (https://www.virtualbox.org/wiki/Downloads)- Install Vagrant (https://www.vagrantup.com/downloads.html) What we'll need:• A laptop See you all soon!
events.location: Oracle Corporation, Singapore, Level 12 Galaxis, 1 Fusionopolis Place

events.name: Zilliqa: Sharding in Action & Security by Design
events.description: Blockchains have the potential to revolutionize the way traditional services get delivered to end users with the promise of decentralization, security and transparency. The inability to scale to the demands of internet-scale user base however, has limited the real-world applications of blockchains. Zilliqa is a new high-throughput public blockchain platform that can enable real-world applications hitherto not possible. The novel idea that makes Zilliqa scalable is the concept of sharding. Proposed by some of the Zilliqa team members in a research paper, the idea of sharding has been brought to life with the Zilliqa testnet (first globally). Zilliqa testnet can reach thousands of transactions per second without sacrificing security and decentralization. Join us on 23 May, 2018 (Wednesday) to find out more about our progress, which partners are coming onboard, key initiatives and a preview of our new smart contract language Scilla that enables unprecedented security for smart contracts. Agenda:18:45 - 19:05 Zilliqa Progress Update19:05 - 19:35 Session with partners of Zilliqa and other key initiatives19:35 - 20:05 Demo: Sharding & Secure smart contracts with Scilla20:05 - 20:20 Q&A20:20 - 21:00 Networking The livestream link will be revealed before the event starts on 23 May 2018. *Early birds will receive a Zilliqa t-shirt. Limited stocks are available and doors open at 18:15. This event is brought to you in collaboration with The Bridge.
events.location: The Metro @ thebridge, #01-07, Ascent, 2science Park drive, Singapore

events.name: Profede - Decentralized Professional Protocol
events.description: Hey Likers, Join us in the private-sale event by Profede, the Decentralized Professional Protocol, whereby keen investors are most welcome, and 15%-30% bonus will be given when you sign up during private sale. *Please confirm your attendance in eventbrite link:https://www.eventbrite.sg/e/profede-private-sale-tickets-46055694823or in the telegram group:https://t.me/joinchat/GKMRn05XF_-zhaLYDTmEiw Event Schedule6.30pm-7.30pm Networking withcocktail reception7.30pm-8.30pm Profede ProtocolPresentation byJuan Imaz -CEO,Profede ICO8.30pm-9.30pm Open Discussion https://www.profede.com The technology behind the Profede Professional Protocol is a distributed blockchain-based system, where professionals store their anonymous professional data and get paid in Professional Activity Tokens (PATO) for providing their contact info to businesses or other professionals interested in contacting them. Profede is based on the open source Ethereum technology and the Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM) distributed computing platform. The EVM runs smart contracts (pieces of code) stored in the blockchain ensuring the rules defined by Profede. Professional behavior and data is worth billions to businesses.Why shouldn’t professionals be compensated for this?In the current professional ecosystem, businesses are forced to pay large amounts of capital to recruiting and social selling “intermediaries”, who target contacts but provide little-to-no direct value to the professional. Why should professionals do all the work while intermediaries reap all the benefits? The SolutionProfessionals should have control over who can receive their professional data and how others can use it. Our decentralized professional ecosystem helps you get compensated for your data, making intermediaries unnecessary. Profede is the next generation of professional data privacy. Thanks to blockchain, you can be sure your data is protected. ￼ Professionals Make The Money Instead of the intermediaries, professionals will be the ones who are fairly compensated every time a business gets in touch with them. ￼ Join the Fun Cryptocurrencies are booming! Start earning PATOs and trading them in the best exchanges. ￼ Private Data Your professional data is only your business. If somebody wants to reach you they will have to pay the price set by you. Our track record Together we are experts in Finance, Telecommunications, Internet Unicorns, Smart Contracts, Blockchain Architecture, Digital Identity and Asset/Service Tokenization. Furthermore, we have worked with some impressive organizations. *Westin cocktail reception will be provided.
events.location: The Westin Singapore, Breakout Room on 3rd floor, 12 Marina View, Asia Square, Tower 2

events.name: DevOps is DevO̸p̸s̸ by Chai Feng
events.description: ### Abstract DevOps is a popular buzzword these days. But what does it mean for software development and operations points of view? Is there a difference in technical skills of people who focus mostly on development or operations? Developers are becoming more and more familiar with technical practices like TDD and refactoring and modern tools like Jenkins and Cucumber. Such practices and tools help them write better code. For operations, it seems like there are only modern tools like Ansible and Docker, and little focus on good technical practices. Do sysadmins only like to discover new tools? More and more people recognize the value of full-stack engineers and cross-functional teams. We hear about continuous delivery, continuous deployment, continuous integration. It may indicate different activities performed by different people, but they are very closely related. All software projects contain both application code and operations and maintenance scripts. Everything is just code and must be treated in the same way. When teams try to adopt DevOps without treating operations scripts with the same diligence as software code, they will usually face problems. Introducing new modern tools like Ansible and Kubernetes cannot solve those problems automatically. This presentation is about another perspective on DevOps and how to avoid those problems. It is split into three parts: 1. Why Dev and Ops are the same things2. Which problems disappear when you consider Dev and Ops as the same thing3. How to do a better DevOps adoption ### About Chai Feng Chai Feng is a software developer and a technical coach at Odd-e. He has over 15 years of programming experience as well as leading technical teams. He is also experienced in Unix and Linux systems, IT operations, automated testing (mobile/web/desktop) and continuous delivery. Since he joined Odd-e in 2014, he shares his experience as a coach by helping teams to develop better engineering practices such as Test-driven development, Specification by Examples, Refactoring, Continuous Integration, etc. More recently he has also been helping teams to adopt DevOps practices. He has worked on product development in various industries including banking, insurance, telecommunications, healthcare, education, and government. He has built embedded applications, mobile communication gateway, web and mobile applications. ### Agenda 7:00pm Networking with refreshments7:30pm Presentation8:00pm Discussion9:00pm End
events.location: Credit Suisse, Wealth Institute, Level 2 North Tower, One Raffles Link, Singapore

events.name: Blockchain in EdTech and HRTech - #Crypto to the Next Frontier
events.description: Hi there! It is the #industry40 and technological advancements are here to stay. It is said that 40% of jobs will change by 2020. What we see and know today may not be relevant in the near future. In this event, we explore that to heart focusing on two key aspects of how we live. Education: Education has only started to change in the last 10 years. With the introduction of Blackboard, schools have started to pick up technological tools to help in classroom learning. But things are now starting to change in the 20th century due to two key things. Game-Based Learning: In the 1980s, MIT professor Thomas Malone (1981) maintained that games motivate players with elements of challenge, fantasy and curiosity. Given numerous studies support the positive effects of games on learning, a growing number of researchers are committed to developing educational games to promote students’ 21st-century skill development in schools. However what is unique now is the manner of internet penetration, mobile, and accessibility to connections that can bring Games to Real Life. Coupled with Blockchain (To be described below), an integrated solution could be revolutionary. In this session - we talk about one use-case has been sponsored by the Singapore government and in BETA with education institutions in Singapore to trial this. Whats especially exciting in Blockchain is the usecase for credentials signaling and an eco-system to facilitate and support references. Blockchain: Blockchain is at the forefront of today’s technological and financial innovation with pulpits prophesizing its creation being equivalent to the invention of the internet. It is the technology that underpins Bitcoin transactions. Blockchain is a shared database that is secure and anonymous and allows the exchange of goods and documents in a secure way without the involvement of third parties or having to carry out time-consuming tasks for the sake of transparency in order to assess risks and avoid fraud. But learning the Blockchain is never easy. 50% of the success of the Blockchain is non-tech often not talked about and even less research on. In this 2 hour session, the two soaring Blockchain Entrepreneurs will share about the tech, the philosophy, and the resulting ideas to help de-mystify Blockchain in Personal Growth and Business. What is a Blockchain and what makes it so special amongst the other revolutionary concepts that has graced this century? The event ends in a panel discussion about where we are, how the public could join the community, contribute to Blockchain and how to get started. Agenda:7pm - Registration7.30pmSpeaker - Daniel Shen, Founder of SoqqleTopic: Designing Surefire Blockchain Applications for the next Human Renaissance8 pmSpeaker - Raymond Ng, Founder of KatalystTopic: This next economics is around the corner to change how we do business - Tokenomics830-9pm - Panel and Closing Bio: Daniel ShenDaniel Shen has more than 10 years of experience in investment banking & Fintech. Well-versed in process re-engineering, innovation, human capital, he created the first Blockchain POC team in J.P. Morgan Hong Kong. With battle-tested project management expertise, he is also the founder of Soqqle – a gamified learning platform to bring beneficial educational games into the class-room. He recently won a government-sponsored grant, showcased his product in a Singapore Youth Conference hosted by the National Youth Council. Bio: RaymondIn the past 16 years, Mr Raymond Ng has seen over 16,000 business prospects and served no less than 3,000 of them as a management consultant. As a result of this experience, he has intimate understanding of designing tokenomics in a Blockchain project. Raymond Ng is now the founder of KatalystCoin (www.katalystcoin.com) - the first Proof of Loyalty blockchain to record and reward all economic activities. Alternate Registration: http://edtechdecentralized.eventbrite.com
events.location: Officience, 16A Le Hong Phong (pro-long), Ward 12, District 10, Singapore

events.name: Powering Intelligence at the Digital Edge
events.description:
Speaker: Tejaswini Tilak, Senior Director, Vertical Marketing, Equinix 
Digital transformation is accelerating across all industries. Key trends are creating the need for real-time interaction and forcing digital services to the edge. All firms need to manage data and security locally, while trading digital goods and services globally. Solving for this requires an interconnection-ready approach, connecting to partners and providers of choice around the world and integrating services leveraging software controls.
Learn best practices from a proven, repeatable architectural framework, called the Interconnection Oriented Architecture (IOA) to solve for the intelligent digital edge of the future.
events.location: Ocean Financial Centre, 10 Collyer Quay, #16-01, Singapore 049315
events.group_name: Verizon Innovation Community Managed by JustCo
